titleStmt.title: Dauids palme and cedar shewing the reward of the righteous. In a sermon preached at Eccleston church in Lancashire; Iuly, 25. 1614. being the day of dedication of Heskine Schoole: founded by Sir Iames Pemberton knight, late alderman and citizen of London. By William Leigh Bachelor ini Diuinity, and pastor at Standish.
titleStmt.author: Leigh, William, 1550-1639.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Thomas Creede for Arthur Iohnson, and are to be sold at his shop in Paules churchyard, nere the great ..,

notesStmt.note: Identified as STC 15423a on UMI microfilm, and as STC 15423.45 in the Folger Shakespeare Library Catalogue.

Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
